title: Makes the director of the state office for the aging a member of the emergency services council
summary: Makes the director of the state office for the aging a member of the emergency services council.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         4137

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   February 1, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  ENGLEBRIGHT -- read once and referred to the
         Committee on Aging

       AN ACT to amend the executive law; in relation to making the director of
         the state office for the aging a  member  of  the  emergency  services
         council

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 1 of section 580 of the executive law, as added
    2  by chapter 300 of the laws of 2000, is amended to read as follows:
    3    1. Creation; members. There is hereby created  in  the  department  of
    4  state  an  emergency services council, the members of which shall be the
    5  directors of the office of fire prevention and control,  the  bureau  of
    6  emergency  medical  services  and the state emergency management office,
    7  the superintendent of state police,  the  commissioner  of  health,  the
    8  secretary  of  state, THE DIRECTOR OF THE STATE OFFICE FOR THE AGING and
    9  the director of state operations who shall  be  the  chairperson  unless
   10  otherwise  appointed  by the governor. There shall also be two represen-
   11  tatives appointed by the state emergency medical services  council,  one
   12  of whom shall be a representative of volunteer ambulance service and one
   13  of  whom shall be a representative of proprietary ambulance service; two
   14  representatives appointed by the fire advisory board, one of which shall
   15  be representative of volunteer fire service and one of  which  shall  be
   16  representative  of  paid  fire  service;  one  representative  shall  be
   17  appointed by the disaster preparedness commission; one  physician  shall
   18  be  appointed  by  the  state  emergency medical advisory committee; one
   19  appointment shall be made by the governor; one appointment shall be made
   20  by the temporary president of the senate; and one appointment  shall  be
   21  made by the speaker of the assembly.
   22    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
